answers.answer: I am not a Dr. but I can tell you that there is very little risk with this surgery other than that to a regular patient as long as her sugar levels are kept very close to normal before and after the surgery.  It sounds like she is well on the way to getting it right now and your worries seem slight.

question: Dear Sir,I have a relative who is diabetic for the past 15 years and mismanaged for about the first 10 years, however she is now under the care of a good practioner and has managed to get the diabetes under check.She is 60 years old and has significant microalbuminiria and elevated creatinine , uric acid and urea.However i heard that her Hb1Ac is now 5.5 down from 7.9, and he insulin does is steady at 34 units and 24 units.She is undergoing cataract surgery and i would like to know the prognosis of this and the likely prognosis for her kidney ,I know i am unable to give you her exact blood values for the tests taken but shall be grateful if you could just give me a broad outline of the prognosis. Just that he Diabetes was grossly mismanaged by a quack for along time.thank you.
title: complications of diabetic eye surgery
